intro: Selago densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered selago, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Selago densiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky areas.
